title: 2 bedroom terraced house for rent
description: Interior & Architecture <PARA> In the world of compact living, this distinctive London house was something of an early adopter. Originally a ransom strip of land connecting the street to a now-demolished building behind, the house was built circa 1930 and later refurbished in the 1950s. More recently, it has been thoughtfully cared for and refined, resulting in a home that feels both characterful and highly considered. <PARA> For such a compact footprint, there is an impressive amount to unpack. Every square foot across the three floors has been carefully designed to maximise space, light and functionality. <PARA> Even at just seven feet wide, the house has a striking presence within Peel Street’s historic terrace. A passion for the Arts and Crafts era is evident throughout, with decorative detailing extending to the façade: a zinc-canopied entrance, curved window cover and a custom dragon’s-head downpipe — a symbolic nod to the movement. Inside, beautifully patinated parquet flooring runs through the ground-floor kitchen, entered via an ornate stained-glass front door. <PARA> The ground floor immediately surprises. Ceiling heights and proportions lend a Tardis-like quality to the open-plan kitchen and dining space — equally suited to relaxed dinners with friends or quiet mornings with coffee. <PARA> Between this space and one of the two bedrooms sits an ingeniously arranged shower room and WC. The bedroom itself continues the Arts and Crafts theme, paired with industrial-style solid wood flooring. Glazed double doors lead to a small light well, offering a sliver of private outdoor space. <PARA> The first-floor reception room is rich with period character. An elegant decorative fireplace forms the focal point, complemented by exposed floorboards. At the rear, glazed doors open onto a generous decked terrace with ornate balustrading — a wonderfully private spot for alfresco dining or evening drinks in warmer months. <PARA> A final flight of warm wooden stairs leads to the top-floor suite. Here, a front-facing sash window sits within a half-eaved wall, while a notably spacious en-suite bathroom completes the internal accommodation. <PARA> In the Neighbourhood <PARA> Notting Hill Gate and the wider Kensington neighbourhood are defined by their access to green space, with both Kensington Gardens and Holland Park just a short walk away. <PARA> Peel Street itself offers an appealing village-like feel, quietly tucked away from the wider pace of London. Nearby Kensington Church Street provides an excellent selection of boutiques, cafés, restaurants and bars, making this an ideal base from which to enjoy the city. <PARA> Transport & Connections <PARA> Notting Hill Gate station (Central Line) is within easy walking distance, while High Street Kensington offers District and Circle Line connections, providing excellent access across London. <PARA> Material Information <PARA> • Property construction: Traditional brick <PARA> • Heating type: Electric heaters <PARA> • Utilities: Electricity, Water & Broadband <PARA> • Electricity supply: Independently supplied by EDF Energy <PARA> • Water supply & Sewerage: Mains connected via Thames Water <PARA> • Broadband: Standard download speed 16Mbps, Upload speed 1Mbps.Ultrafast available (d/s & u/s 1000Mbps). Source: Ofcom <PARA> • Mobile signal/coverage: Likely good interior & exterior cover on all major networks. Source: Ofcom <PARA> • Restrictions: Located in the Kensington Conservation Area. <PARA> • Flood risk: Very low surface water flooding, no likelihood of any other flooding. Source: Gov.uk <PARA> • Planning permission: None known upon time of listing. Source: Royal Borough of Kensington & Chelsea <PARA> • Accessibility/adaptations: Unsuitable for wheelchair users. <PARA> • Coalfield or mining area: No. Source: The Coal Authority <PARA> • Flight path: Yes. title: 2 bedroom flat for rent
description: Nestled within the historic Bourne Estate in Clerkenwell, this beautifully presented two-bedroom flat offers a blend of classic character and modern practicality. With generous proportions, high ceilings, and newly fitted double-glazed sash windows, the property includes a separate kitchen, bright reception room, and access to a communal garden. Available from 15th March on a part-furnished or fully furnished basis, this home provides flexibility, style, and comfort in a prime central location. <PARA> The spacious reception room is filled with natural light from two large sash windows overlooking gardens and features a charming pitched ceiling. There is ample room for both lounge seating and dining, with wooden floors enhancing the bright and airy atmosphere. This room will remain part-furnished with an ottoman sofa, a table with four chairs, a TV stand, and wall art for a homely touch. <PARA> The separate kitchen is well-appointed with fitted cabinetry, dark worktops, and integrated shelving. Appliances include a freestanding fridge freezer, a new electric cooker, a brand new washer-dryer, and a microwave. A large window views and excellent natural light, with tiled flooring and splashbacks lending a clean finish. <PARA> The larger of the two bedrooms features a wide window with garden views, high ceilings, and a calm, neutral décor. It is offered part-furnished with an ottoman double bed and side tables, with a large walk-in wardrobe. <PARA> The second bedroom benefits from dual-aspect windows and practical layout options. It will include a double bed and a storage unit if taken furnished. <PARA> The modern bathroom has been stylishly updated with soft sage green tiling, a full-sized bath with rainfall shower and glass screen, a pedestal basin, and contemporary black fixtures. <PARA> Residents have access to a communal garden within the estate, offering a pleasant outdoor space to relax. Additionally, Spa Fields Park and the gardens of Gray's Inn are nearby, providing peaceful green pockets in the city. <PARA> This location places you moments from Leather Lane Market, Exmouth Market, and the vibrant shops and restaurants of Clerkenwell and Farringdon. Nearby amenities include supermarkets, cafés, gyms, and independent boutiques, as well as cultural landmarks such as the new London Museum, Charles Dickens Museum and Sadler's Wells Theatre. <PARA> Extremely well-connected, the property is close to Farringdon Station (Elizabeth, Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines, plus National Rail and Thameslink services) and Chancery Lane (Central line). All four London airports can be easily accessed by public transport. Bus routes on Clerkenwell Road and Gray's Inn Road offer further travel options, while permit parking is available for residents. <PARA> ADDITIONAL INFORMATION <PARA> The property is non-smoking. Pets allowed. title: 2 bedroom terraced house for rent
description: A beautifully presented two-bedroom home blending period character with modern living, arranged over two floors and complemented by a separate home office/outbuilding. Located in the Henley town centre just a short walk from all local amenities the River Thames and the train station, benefitting from Residents Parking. AVAILABLE IMMEDIATELY. <PARA> The ground floor offers a welcoming sitting room featuring a log burner and bay window that allows plenty of natural light, this leads through to a generous open dining room perfect for entertaining. To the rear is a well-appointed kitchen, fitted with modern units and appliances, with access to the garden. A contemporary bathroom completes the ground floor. <PARA> Upstairs, the property provides two bright and well-proportioned double bedrooms, both benefitting from built in storage. <PARA> To the rear of the property is a private garden, with the added advantage of a detached home office/outbuilding and separate storage room. <PARA> PLEASE NOTE THAT ALL PROPERTIES ARE TAKEN AS SEEN AND NO ALTERATIONS, ADDITIONS OR CLEANING WILL BE UNDERTAKEN BY THE LANDLORD UNLESS SPECIFICALLY AGREED AT THE TIME OF OFFER. <PARA> Local Authority: South Oxfordshire District Council - Band C <PARA> Furnishings: This property is to be let on an unfurnished basis. <PARA> Rent: Rent payable in advance exclusive of Council Tax and all connected utilities. <PARA> Holding Deposit: A deposit equivalent to one week’s rent is required to secure the property (subject to contract and receipt of satisfactory references). The property will be withdrawn from the market once the holding deposit has cleared in the Ballards bank account. This is non-refundable in the event of unsatisfactory references, false or misleading information was provided or the withdrawal of your offer. <PARA> Dilapidations Deposit: A deposit equivalent to five weeks’ Rent if the annual rent is less than £50,000.00, or equivalent to six weeks' Rent if the annual rent is £50,000.00 or more, will be required to be held throughout the Tenancy as security against damages or any breach of the agreement by the Tenant. The dilapidations deposit will be registered with an approved deposit protection scheme (unless the contract is a Non-Assured Shorthold Tenancy Agreement). <PARA> Fees and Charges: Other fees and charges may apply if the Tenant breaches any of the clauses contained within the official Tenancy documents, details of which can be found on the Ballards website – <PARA> References: We will require at least two of the following references – Employers, accountant, financial, credit or Landlord. The credit check will be collected via an outside agency and therefore the necessary personal details/information will be supplied to them as part of the credit referencing process. <PARA> Pets: If you wish to keep a pet at a property then you must declare this in the first instance, as you will need to obtain the Landlords consent in writing via the Agent, prior to the commencement of the Tenancy. <PARA> Membership Names and Numbers: <PARA> Tenancy Deposit Scheme Membership Number – G02899 <PARA> The Property Ombudsman Membership Number – D03311 <PARA> Safeagent Licence Number – A2716 <PARA> Due to new regulations, Ballards are now required to obtain proof of identity for each Tenant who rents a property via our agency. For this purpose, we are required to hold a copy of Photocard Driving Licence, Passport, and current utility bill. We may also require proof of permission to reside in the UK. <PARA> Important Note: For clarification, we wish to inform all applicants that we have not carried out a detailed survey, nor tested the services, appliances and specific fittings. Room sizes should not be relied upon for furnishings and no responsibility is taken for any error, omission or mis-statement in any of the marketing material for the property.
